abstract.text: Initiates a rendering cycle for an audio unit.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The audio unit that you are asking to render.
Flags to configure the rendering operation.

The audio time stamp for the render operation. Each time stamp must contain a valid sample time that is incremented monotonically from the previous call to this function. That is, the next time stamp is equal to
If sample time does not increase like this from one render call to the next, the audio unit interprets that as a discontinuity with the timeline it is rendering for.

When rendering to multiple output buses, ensure that this value is the same for each bus. Using the same value allows an audio unit to determine that the rendering for each output bus is part of a single render operation.
The output bus to render for.
The number of audio sample frames to render.
On input, the audio buffer list that the audio unit is to render into. On output, the audio data that was rendered by the audio unit.
The
that you provide on input must match the topology for the current audio format for the given bus. The buffer list can be either of these two variants:
If the
pointers are non-null, the audio unit renders its output into those buffers
If the
pointers are null, the audio unit can provide pointers to its own buffers. In this case, the audio unit must keep those buffers valid for the duration of the calling thread’s I/O cycle.
A result code.

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Called by the system when an audio unit requires input samples, or before and after a render operation.
The data type for a plug-in component that provides audio processing or audio data generation.
Registers a callback to receive audio unit render notifications.
Unregisters a previously-registered render listener callback function.
Initiates a rendering cycle for an audio unit.
Flags for configuring audio unit rendering.
Update your Audio Unit (AU) host app to take advantage of the new features and capabilities of AUv3.

doc://com.apple.audiotoolbox/documentati.title: Migrating Your Audio Unit Host to the AUv3 API

abstract.text: A structure that stores a variable-length array of audio buffers.
A structure that represents a timestamp value.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
